result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:42 AM Defendant PETER C ROWAN in court, in custody.  Attorney Lawrence Jean Broeren in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Katherine Cook in court for PETER C ROWAN. 
20CM363, 21CF148, 22CF56
Defendant informed of charges and penalties. 
Guilty Plea Questionnaire reviewed by Court.

Defense stipulates to Court relying on probable cause portion of complaint
Court finds factual basis to support the plea
Acknowledges prior conviction(s). 
Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1 of amended information
Court finds plea plea as knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently made, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty as to Count 1 of amended information in 21CF148
Count 2 DRI/merge
22CF56 DRI
20CM363 DRI
21TR757 DRi
All amounts posted to be applied toward costs.

3 years prison:  Bifurcated sentence:  1 year 6 months IC, 1 year 6 months ES - 231 days of jail credit - consecutive to any other sentence.

Fine and costs - $2,327.00
DNA and surcharge $250
$36.40 blood draw

IID, eligible for 1/2 price

DNA Sample

Attorney Katherine Cook advises a new offer was received from the State and wishes to discuss with her client and requests a status.
Bond continued.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.
(Jail/9043)

04:05 PM Defendant PETER C ROWAN in court with Attorney Katherine Cook.  Defendant PETER C ROWAN in custody.  Lawrence Jean Broeren appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Bond continued.  Review hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

BOND COVERS 20CM363 (MODIFIED) AND 21CF148 (MODIFIED) TO ALSO COVER 22CF56 (NEW)- $500 PREVIOUSLY POSTED 06/24/2021
